thread.title: The "Thank You Obama" Collection From Joe Fresh Will Make You Feel Better About 2017
thread.title_full: The "Thank You Obama" Collection From Joe Fresh Will Make You Feel Better About 2017

title: The "Thank You Obama" Collection From Joe Fresh Will Make You Feel Better About 2017
text: February 3, 2017 Courtesy of brand Since the Obamas’ departure from the White House last month, the fashion community, which was so influenced by the power couple, has been mulling over the Obama legacy—and, specifically, how to pay tribute to it. For the designers behind Joe Fresh Goods, a Chicago-based streetwear brand, it’s with a fashion blogger-ready "Thank You Obama" Collection. The limited-edition collection pays homage to the 44th president with some sick graphic art, fresh twists on iconic Americana (think classic jerseys and an Ivy League–worthy “Malia” tee), and even an airbrushed tee paying tribute to Barack and Michelle’s blessed union (you can also get some “f*ck Donald" swag if you’re so inclined). The unisex collection, which initially sold out on thankuobama.us , is currently on back order thanks to its overwhelming popularity. You May Also Like Fashion Post-FLOTUS Style: Michelle Obama Looks Gorgeous as Always on Vacation Joe Fresh is not the first designer to thank the former First Couple. In the final days of Michelle’s reign as First Lady, designers penned handwritten notes of thanks to FLOTUS for her contribution to the industry. It begs the question: Where’s our “Thanks Michelle” capsule collection? Naturally, we envision it would be a high-low collaboration of up-and-coming American designers and foreign brands capturing the message of globalization and inclusivity that Michelle used to make her mark. Courtesy of brand
